answers.answer: Hi and welcome to the Migraines & Headaches Community.The dizziness, sore neck and possibly the sore eyes could be attributed to migraines. But, not the back pain. I am stumped. Might be time for a second opinion.
Yes, it is very frustrating to say the least.  I am in reasonably good shape, and I even run 2 miles x 3 days per week.  I don't know what type of specialist I should see though.  Any ideas?

Chiropractor for your back for starters. Might need to see a Neurologist for the other stuff if your primary doctor does not have those symptoms diagnosed and under control. And if all else fails I'd try a pain specialist.

question: 45 yr old, caucasion, male, 6ft, 200 lbs.I have been experiencing the following symptoms for months now.Radiating headache (off and on)slight dizziness (off and on)stiff/sore neck (off and on)sore/dry eyes (off and on)low back pain/stiffness (chronic).My Dr has run 2 different sets of blood work as well as urinalysis.  I am a high blood pressure patient for over 10 years, but my bp is very well and that isn't the issue.  He has eliminated most things including...diabetes, lupus, all the STDs, etc...My appetite is fine, I sleep well, drink lots of water all day long as well.  Does anyone have any suggestions or ideas?  Please help.
title: Weird Symptoms
